repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, and writings, primarily documenting the professional career and personal life of James Tobin as an economist and educator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Tobin, 1999; Elizabeth Tobin, 2002, 2004, and 2006. Gift of Roger G. Tobin and Linda M. Blum, 2004; Gift of William C. Brainard, 2005. Gift of Cowles Foundation, 2005.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 17 of the original accession is restricted until January 1, 2024, and Box 19 of the original accession is restricted until January 1, 2074 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.

Boxes 13-19 of Accession 2004-M-088 are restricted until January 1, 2045, without the written permission of any one of Tobin's children or William C. Brainard in accordance with the requirements of the donor's deed of gift.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James Tobin Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Tobin, Nobel laureate and long-time professor of economics at Yale University, was born in Champaign, Illinois, in 1918. In 1939, he graduated from Harvard University, where he also obtained his master's degree in 1940 and his Ph.D. in 1947. He worked in the Office of Price Administration and on the Civilian Supply and War Production Board before enlisting in the navy in 1941 and serving as an officer aboard the USS Kearney. Tobin began his career at Yale in 1950 as an associate professor, and went on to become the Sterling Professor of Economics. In 1961, he was asked to serve on the Council of Economic Advisors to President John F. Kennedy. His highly regarded work as a Keynesian macro economist, particularly the development of his "portfolio selection theory," earned him the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science in 1981. Tobin married Elizabeth Fay Ringo in 1946; they had four children: Margaret, Louis, Hugh, and Roger. Tobin died on March 11, 2002, in New Haven.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, and writings, primarily documenting the professional career and personal life of James Tobin as an economist and educator.

did.unittitle: Class notes [lecture notes taken by Tobin in undergraduate courses]

accessrestrict.p: Material in these teaching files is restricted until January 1, 2074 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.

accessrestrict.p: Yale University records are restricted until January 1, 2024 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.

did.unittitle: Ad Hoc Committee on Faculty Appointments
Council of Economic Advisors [duplicates of materials sent to the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of files taken from Tobin's office shortly after his death. Dates range from the 1930s to the 2000s. The General files include correspondence, printed matter, and other materials relating to Tobin's work as an economist and professor at Yale University. The files are arranged alphabetically. The Writings comprise predominantly unpublished pieces by Tobin.

did.unittitle: Friends of the South Asian Study Committee-Institute for Social Research
Institute for Women's Policy Research- Korean Daily
Mitsui Lectures- Quarterly Journal of Economics
Topical files including Conference Board on Consumer Price Index, SANWA, Yale Workshop in Quantitative Economic Research, teaching files, personal data, "Kennedy recollections"
Memorial remarks-On the Federal Budget Deficit

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of files taken from Tobin's home two years after his death. Dates range from the 1920s to 2001. The files are primarily personal papers and include correspondence, photographs, manuscript materials, and some memorabilia relating to Tobin's personal life as well as his work as an economist and professor at Yale University. The files have been named and arranged in the order in which they arrived. The broadest headings come from labels affixed to boxes by Elizabeth Tobin (James Tobin's niece) when she prepared the papers for transfer.

Original audiotapes and videotapes in Box 11 and floppy discs in Box 12 are restricted. Researchers should contact the reference archivist to arrange for the creation of use copies of these materials.

The cache of restricted records are restricted until January 1, 2045. Written permission from one of James Tobin's children or William C. Brainard must be obtained to consult these materials. Researchers should consult with the reference archivist for details.

did.unittitle: Letters home from Camp Highlands and other youth related material
"JT Academic Record" in a folder together with this label [report cards]
Materials collected by Jim about his father
University High [high school writings and ephemera]

18th century portraits of James Feliz Tobin
c. 1939-1941 ["1980 copies of Murphy letters of Mis folder given to Murphy"]
Professional correspondence [job offers made to Jim]
Nobel Prize related correspondence and other materials
"MISC for WISC" [includes correspondence with Lawrence Summers and others, notes, and other miscellaneous materials]
Dad's clippings [L. M. Tobin clippings file on James]
U.S. Navy Officer Service Record [includes shoulder board]
Files from Bill Brainard, other work files, speeches, talks, etc.
Manuscript of a textbook on intellectual development, macroeconomics [unpublished, with Bill Brainard, Gary Smith, and Janet Yellin]
Early manuscripts and important professional correspondence
Guideposts [manuscript, probably for Council of Economic Advisors, with background]
Negative Income Tax Experiment - adjudication for Watts and Baumel welfare sampling
"Committee to Study Puerto Rico's Finances, Report to the Governor"
Unpublished manuscript from the 1940s [on "optimizing behavior," parts written in Switzerland in 1959]
"The Tobin Tax: How to Make it Real"

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audio, film, and video recordings, as well as preservation masters and duplicating masters may not be played. Readers may only play use copies. If a use copy of a particular recording does not exist, researchers must consult with the reference archivist for policies and procedures regarding the creation of duplicating master and use copies of original recordings.
